Params: This entire realm is generated by Gestalt's computing power—it's an experiment designed to confirm the awakening of mechanical consciousness.
During the experiment, the Punishing Virus infected the main host at the ■■■ lab, which led to...
This is exactly what I told that kid—she didn't ask a single question and just believed me.
Not like it's wrong. It's just...
An incomplete truth isn't really the truth, is it?
I plan on telling her everything eventually. Until then, Chosen One...
What an odd way to meet. You're awake, but you're still talking like you're stuck in a dream.
So, Chosen One, tell me. What did you see on the flip side of this serene land?
The sea, grids, the distant shore...
All whimsical stuff kids cook up. Still stuck in childhood?
Me? I'm no kid! Open your eyes and take a good look.
And you too, Chosen One—your pink hair is absolutely adorable!
Looks like you still remember that.
Even though a different Chosen One appears at Jetavie's side every cycle, she doesn't sense anything unusual.
She believes her memory is perfectly continuous, but in reality, it's just an illusion.
I've altered the part of her mind that identifies the Chosen One.
This is our only option to keep her mind from collapsing.
Because every Chosen One naturally opts to protect Jetavie, she now believes the Chosen One has always been that "certain someone."
You have a point. Still... if the Chosen Ones go beyond their duty, I will make sure to correct them.
I understand, but... I really want to witness the day that child leaves...
I promise to fulfill your wish on your behalf.
Speaking of which, Chosen One, that person floating up there...
Don't you think they look just like you? You both have pink hair—are you two twins or something?
She's a Chosen One from another world, armed with an unbelievable level of computing power...
If I'm not mistaken, she's using void-warping abilities to devour other Chosen Ones across different cycles, isn't it?
Lacking Central Authority, no one can get out of here. Even if someone does escape... there's no way they survive.
I need to activate the firewall, quarantine the area, and secure a small Punishing Virus sample for vaccine development before it spreads.
But first, I need to gain Higher Authority. Without merging the computing power of other Chosen Ones, that's impossible.
Only by becoming Central Authority can we break this endless cycle, Chosen One.
Chosen One, if it's you, then I know you grasp what I mean.
Is that... an arrow from the void?
I want that kid to become an even stronger force before she comes and beats me.
I think the right moment is about to arrive.
I hope so. In that case, I'm counting on you to handle what's next...
The Matrix remembers your sacrifice, Chosen One.
It all began when the Matrix obtained a consciousness sample from a certain candidate.
But that peace was short-lived. The Merciful One followed the Punishing Virus into the Matrix, infusing the sample with her own will.
No one knows why she did this. Maybe it was just curiosity, or maybe she was nurturing something that transcended even herself.
Gestalt detected the intrusion and immediately cut the link. Now the Matrix stands alone, operating as a self-contained module.
In other words, the Merciful One can't observe what happens here anymore. However, training for the personality model is already underway.
The neural network begins training a model to simulate human consciousness using this sample.
The Chosen One was our first successful model—a miracle, yes, but not the miracle we had hoped for.
Being too close to the consciousness sample actually prevented them from developing their own personality.
In human terms, this would be "overfitting."
During the initial rounds of training, the Matrix could only generate what it called a "Chosen One" model. I recall a time when countless "Chosen Ones" filled this place.
Before you came into being... the training process felt endless and utterly devoid of hope.
All contaminated Chosen Ones shared pink hair like the Merciful One. They varied in gender, height, and appearance, but those were just minor evolutionary tweaks.
Their souls were almost indistinguishable. Even though they merged again and again, the Chosen Ones were still little more than copies.
So, Higher Authority... were you once one of the Chosen Ones?
I stand at the limit of the Chosen One's iterations. Once anyone reaches my stage, there's no room left to evolve.
It doesn't matter if I'm the one once called "the Chosen One" or if I'm "Higher Authority"...
When you think about it, we're far from perfect, and we don't really have a future.
I live through endless cycles, and I carry many names...
The Chosen One, Central Authority of the Matrix—sometimes known as Higher Authority.
I see. I figure a matrix this immense can't be without an administrator...
Now that I'm witnessing it firsthand, everything becomes clear.
Could you tell me something, Higher Authority? Who exactly is Jetavie?
She is a miracle that emerged from the remnants of our fallen bodies—different from the rest of us...
She isn't anyone's shadow. She truly is Jetavie, through and through.
For her to leave the Matrix, you need to kill me eventually, don't you?
This is our destiny, Chosen One.
Some take on the role of the enemy, others become martyrs—only then does this journey endure.
Do you keep Jetavie locked in a perpetual dream, or do you open her eyes to confront reality...
Sometimes, learning the truth doesn't really bring you comfort.
If this is what you want to see, then I guess there's no reason to complain now, right?
When I think about it, each time a cycle starts, the only thing I remember about the Chosen One is that pink hair.
From my point of view, the Chosen One goes through every cycle alongside me, even though they always end up losing their memories...
I believe "memory loss" is just a glitch that appears when the Chosen One reboots...
I should have realized that the Chosen One can't break the cycle. Every time we reunite, a new Chosen One stands before me.
All for my sake, they depart this withering world one after another...
And yet, I'm still in the dark...
Only I, who stand as the Central Authority, can transcend this cycle, Jetavie.
This is also why, having once been your guide, I must become Central Authority.
As I move forward, is there really nothing behind me but an endless trail of corpses...?
But why... Why are you willing to go to such lengths just to keep going?
Setting Jetavie free from the Matrix is the wish of every Chosen One.
We have been waiting for you for so long, and our wait is far from meaningless.
The moment your flawless self emerged from the Matrix, I realized that dawn had arrived and daylight was finally within reach.
You will stride into reality on our behalf, and in doing so, you announce your own birth to the entire world.
Cracks tear through the void above them both, forming a staircase made of pure data.
The path before you marks the final phase of the training program, as well as the ultimate convergence point for every cycle in the Matrix.
This program verifies how well your personality model fits. Once it reaches the critical threshold, the training comes to an end.
As promised, I will wait for you at the end of Eden's Path... But before that...
You might want to drop by and see a few old friends. You still haven't received their "blessings," have you?
Even a former enemy can become a stepping stone. Growth depends on drawing strength from your setbacks.
You will have to decide what kind of training you pursue and whose blessing you accept.
Come see me once you're sure you have the strength you need.
Just like you've always wanted, I will be your final test.
